info.name: openEHR_Ehrscape
info.description:
API Calls for Ehrscape-based, openEHR CDRs (Clinical Data Repositories) including NHS Code4Health platform, Operon Cloud Platform,the Marand Ehrscape platform, and Ripple EtherCis platform.

For general guidance on the use of this API see [here](https://github.com/freshehr/postman-ehrscape/blob/master/README.md)

This collection relies on an associated environment file to setup environment variables.

## Ehrscape Authorization
For testing purposes, Ehrscape Authorisation is normally handled on a per-call basis by passing a Basic Auth string in the `Authorization` header.

However it is also possible to perform authorisation by creating a session token via the /session POST call and `Ehr-Session` header. In order for the session tokens to be used, you must change the `SessionHeader` environment variable from `Ehr-Session-disabled` to `Ehr-Session`.

i.e.

1. To enable Basic Auth authentication set the environment variable `SessionHeader=Ehr-Session-disabled`

2. To enable session token authentication set the environment variable
`SessionHeader=Ehr-Session`
 
You will have to run the /session POST call once per session to store the Ehr-Session token.
 
## Operon Cloud Platform API Authorization

Access to the Operon Cloud Platform requires you to pass the Operon Ehrscape Sandbox API Authorization which you were issued, as an additional ``Auth-Token`` header. 

This is supported in this Postman collection - you just need to ensure that you populate the header directly or via the ``Auth-Token`` Postman environment variable (normally supplied as part of Operon Cloud registration process).

                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                          <items id="description">Laboratoriesvar som en enkeltverdi eller i grupper/pakker som er vanlig i kliniske prveanalyser.</items>
                          <items id="text">Laboratoriesvargruppe</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                          <items id="description">Faktisk verdi av prvesvaret. Navnet p dette dataelementet er vanligvis erstattet i templat eller i applikasjon, slik at det samsvarer med den faktiske analysen. For eksempel "S-Na" eller "Serum Natrium". Det vil ogs som regel vre kodet ved hjelp av et kodeverk.</items>
                          <items id="text">Svarverdi</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                          <items id="description">Spesifikt detaljert svar, som inkluderer bde verdien og tilleggsinformasjon som kan vre nyttig for klinisk tolkning.</items>
                          <items id="text">Analysesvar</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                          <items id="description">Kommentar til svaret.</items>
                          <items id="text">Kommentar</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                          <items id="description">Tilleggsinformasjon med rd for referanseomrdets hensiktsmessighet.</items>
                          <items id="text">Veiledning til referanseomrdet</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                          <items id="description">Svarverdiens status</items>
                          <items id="text">Svarstatus</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0006">
                          <items id="description">Dato og/eller tidspunkt hele svaret ble utstedt for den registrerte Svarstatus.</items>
                          <items id="text">Tidspunkt for svarstatus</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                          <items id="description">Ikke tilgjengelig svar enn.</items>
                          <items id="text">Registrert</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0008">
                          <items id="description">Dette er et midlertidig eller forelpig svar. Data kan mangle, eller vre uverifisert.</items>
                          <items id="text">Forelpig</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0009">
                          <items id="description">Svaret er komplett og verifisert av ansvarlig laboratorielege.</items>
                          <items id="text">Endelig</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                          <items id="description">Svaret er endret etter  ha hatt status Endelig, og er komplett og verifisert av ansvarlig laboratorielege.</items>
                          <items id="text">Endret</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                          <items id="description">Svaret er ikke tilgjengelig fordi analysen ikke ble pbegynt eller ferdigstilt.</items>
                          <items id="text">Kansellert</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                          <items id="description">Svaret er ikke tilgjengelig siden analysen ikke ble bestilt.</items>
                          <items id="text">Ikke bestilt</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                          <items id="description">Ytterligere detaljer, inkludert informasjon om prveeksemplaret i analysepakker, eller nr materialet deles opp i flere forskjellige analyser.</items>
                          <items id="text">Andre detaljer</items>
                        </term_definitions>

        <archetype_id>
          <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test.v0</value>
        </archetype_id>
        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="comment">Denne arketypen kan brukes for  registrere en enkeltverdi av en analyse, men vil ofte bli spesialisert eller lagt inn i en templat for  representere flere verdier eller pakker av analyser. Denne arketypen fungerer ogs som forelder for spesialiserte laboratoresvar-arketyper, for eksempel mikrobiologi eller patologi.</items>
          <items id="description">Funn og tolkning av laboratorieanalyse utfrt p prvemateriale fra pasient.</items>
          <items id="text">Laboratoriesvar</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0001">
          <items id="description">*@ internal @(en)</items>
          <items id="text">*Event Series(en)</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0002">
          <items id="description">Standard, uspesifisert tidspunkt eller tidsintervall som kan defineres mer eksplisitt i en templat eller i en applikasjon.</items>
          <items id="text">Uspesifisert hendelse</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0003">
          <items id="description">*@ internal @(en)</items>
          <items id="text">*Tree(en)</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0004">
          <items id="description">*@ internal @(en)</items>
          <items id="text">*Tree(en)</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0005">
          <items id="comment">Et prveresultat kan gjelde for en enkelt analyse eller en gruppe av analyser, inkludert analysepakker. Koding med en terminologi, eventuelt med en prekoordinert term inkludert prvetype er  foretrekke, hvis mulig. Kan bli kodet med LOINC eller SNOMED CT eller nasjonale laboratoriekodeverk. Eksempler kan vre "Glukose", "Urea og elektrolytter", "Dyrkning", "Kortisol (morgen)" eller "Leverbiopsi".</items>
          <items id="description">Identifikasjon av den utfrte analysen, av og til inkludert prvetype og pasientens tilstand</items>
          <items id="text">Analysenavn</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0010">
          <items id="comment">Flere formater tillates, men disse m vre semantisk sammenlignbare.</items>
          <items id="description">Representasjon av hele svaret, slik det er utstedt av utfrende laboratorium i rik tekst eller som multimedia.</items>
          <items id="text">Svarrepresentasjon</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0017">
          <items id="description">Demografiske detaljer til laboratoriet som er ansvarlig for analysen.</items>
          <items id="text">Ansvarlig laboratorium</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0035">
          <items id="description">Detaljert informasjon om kliniker eller organisatorisk enhet som skal motta en kopi av laboratoriesvaret.</items>
          <items id="text">Distribusjonsliste</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0037">
          <items id="description">Dette er et delvis (dvs initalt, forelpig eller preliminrt) svar: Data i svaret kan vre ukomplett eller ubekreftet.</items>
          <items id="text">Delvis</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0038">
          <items id="description">Svaret er komplett og er bekreftet av ansvarlig person.</items>
          <items id="text">Endelig</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0040">
          <items id="description">Svaret har blitt endret etter at det var meldt Endelig, og er komplett og verifisert av den ansvarlige laboratorielege, og svardata har blitt endret.</items>
          <items id="text">Revidert</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0057">
          <items id="description">Konsis, tekstlig tolkning av laboratoriesvaret, satt i en klinisk sammenheng.</items>
          <items id="text">Konklusjon</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0062">
          <items id="comment">Tilsvarende HL7 "Placer Order Identifier".</items>
          <items id="description">Lokal ID som er tildelt rekvisisjonen av den som har rekvirert.</items>
          <items id="text">RekvisisjonsID</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0063">
          <items id="comment">En ID tilordnet rekvisisjonen av laboratorieinformasjonssystemet (LIS) pner for sporing av fremdrift og til  koble svar til rekvisisjoner. Det gir ogs en referanse for foresprsler, og tilsvarer som regel HL7 "Filler Order Identifier".</items>
          <items id="description">Lokal ID som er tildelt rekvisisjonen av utfrende laboratorie, vanligvis av laboratoriesystemet (LIS).</items>
          <items id="text">Laboratoriets rekvisisjonsID</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0065">
          <items id="description">Detaljer om prven dersom alle prveresultater er avledet fra samme prvemateriale. Hvis prvematerialet er tilstrekkelig spesifisert med en kode i Prvenavn, er dette dataelementet overfldig. Hvis det er multiple prver, kan disse representeres per "resultatgruppe".</items>
          <items id="text">Prvedetaljer</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0068">
          <items id="description">Lokal ID som er gitt til analysesvaret av laboratoriesystemet (LIS).</items>
          <items id="text">SvarID</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0073">
          <items id="description">Overordnet status p analyseresultatet.</items>
          <items id="text">Analysestatus</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0074">
          <items id="description">Svaret er utilgjengelig fordi analysen ikke ble pbegynt eller ferdigstilt (ogs kalt "avbrutt").</items>
          <items id="text">Kansellert</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0075">
          <items id="description">Dato og/eller tidspunkt hele svaret var utstedt for svarrapporten.</items>
          <items id="text">Dato/tid svarrapport</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0077">
          <items id="comment">For eksempel klinisk biokjemi, mikrobiologi, hematologi, patologi. Dette hjelper klinikere med  filtrere mellom svarkategorier i henhold til lokal organisering av laboratorier. Koding med en terminologi er nskelig, der det er mulig.</items>
          <items id="description">Laboratoriefaglig service som utfrer analysen</items>
          <items id="text">Kategori laboratoriefag</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0090">
          <items id="description">Detaljer knyttet til kliniker eller organisatorisk enhet som revkvirerer analysen.</items>
          <items id="text">Rekvirent</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0094">
          <items id="comment">Det finnes som regel en rekvisisjon for hvert svar, men i noen omstendigheter kan flere rekvisisjoner representeres ved hjelp av en enkelt laboratoriesvar-arketype.</items>
          <items id="description">Detaljer knyttet til en rekvirert enkeltanalyse.</items>
          <items id="text">Rekvisisjonsdetaljer</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0097">
          <items id="description">Detaljer om analysesvar, muligens en individuell analyse, en gruppe, en pakke eller samling av mange svar, eller en mer kompleks og spesifikk struktur.</items>
          <items id="text">Analysesvar</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0098">
          <items id="comment">Koding med en terminologi foretrekkes, der det er mulig.</items>
          <items id="description">Enkeltord, frase eller kort beskrivelse som beskriver teksten i "Konklusjon".</items>
          <items id="text">Diagnose</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0100">
          <items id="comment">I HL7 FHIR lagres denne informasjonen innen lenket requestDetail.clinical.</items>
          <items id="description">Beskrivelse av klinisk informasjon som er tilgjengelig p tolkningstidspunktet, noe som kan inkludere en lenke til den originale kliniske informasjonen som ble gitt i rekvisisjonen.</items>
          <items id="text">Tilgjengelig klinisk informasjon</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0101">
          <items id="description">Tekstlig tilleggsinformasjon som ikke er registrert i andre felt.</items>
          <items id="text">Kommentar</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0106">
          <items id="description">Identifikasjon av den opprinnelige rekvisisjonen, dersom det er forskjell mellom det som er rekvirert og det som faktisk er utfrt.</items>
          <items id="text">Navn p opprinnelig rekvirert analyse</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0107">
          <items id="description">Analysen er registrert i laboratoriesystemet (LIS), men svaret er ikke tilgjengelig per n.</items>
          <items id="text">Registrert</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0110">
          <items id="description">Strukturert tilleggsinformasjon om hvilken analysemetode som er fulgt. For eksempel, strukturerte detaljer om hviken metode laboratoriet har brukt og tolket dataene.</items>
          <items id="text">Detaljer om analysemetode/utstyr</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0111">
          <items id="description">Sann hvis resultatet er basert p analyse med pasientnrt utstyr i stedet for en mer formell laboratorietjeneste.</items>
          <items id="text">Pasientnrt analyseutstyr</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0112">
          <items id="description">*@ internal @(en)</items>
          <items id="text">*Tree(en)</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0113">
          <items id="description">Forhold i tilstanden eller omstendlighetene til en pasient som kan endre tolkningen av laboratoriesvaret.</items>
          <items id="text">Konfunderende faktorer</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0114">
          <items id="description">Detaljer om pasientens tilstand som kan endre tolkning av laboratoriesvaret.</items>
          <items id="text">Detaljer om pasienttilstand</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0115">
          <items id="description">Svaret har blitt modifisert etter  ha vrt i status Ferdig, og er komplett og verifisert av ansvarlig laboratorielege.</items>
          <items id="text">Korrigert</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0116">
          <items id="description">Analysesvaret har blitt trukket tilbake etter  ha vrt i status Endelig.</items>
          <items id="text">Feilregistrert</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0117">
          <items id="description">Ytterligere informasjon som er ndvendig for  registrere lokalt innhold/kontekst, eller for  sammenstille med andre referansemodeller/formalismer.</items>
          <items id="text">Tilleggsinformasjon</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="NPU19719">
          <items id="text">P-CEA</items>
        </term_definitions>
      </children>
      <cardinality>
        <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
        <is_unique>false</is_unique>
        <interval>
          <lower_included>true</lower_included>
          <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
          <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
          <lower>0</lower>
        </interval>
      </cardinality>
    </attributes>
    <archetype_id>
      <value>openEHR-EHR-COMPOSITION.report.v1</value>
    </archetype_id>
    <template_id>
      <value>IAN - Kreftregisteret Kolorektalskjema utredning</value>
    </template_id>
    <term_definitions code="at0000">
      <items id="description">Dokument som brukes for  kommunisere informasjon til andre, ofte som svar p en foresprsel.</items>
      <items id="text">Rapport</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0001">
      <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
      <items id="text">Tree</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0002">
      <items id="description">Rapportidentifikator.</items>
      <items id="text">Rapport ID</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0005">
      <items id="description">Status for hele rapporten. NB: Dette er ikke status for enkeltkomponentene i rapporten.</items>
      <items id="text">Status</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0006">
      <items id="comment">F.eks. lokale informasjonskrav eller ekstra metadata for  samsvare med FHIR eller CIMI ekvivalenter.</items>
      <items id="description">Ytterligere informasjon som er ndvendig for  sammenstille med andre referansemodeller/formalismer.</items>
      <items id="text">Tilleggsinformasjon</items>
    </term_definitions>
  </definition>

request.description: Retrieve a list of available form definitions

item.name: Retrieve a form by name and version

request.description:
Returns a Think!EHR form denoted by its name and version.

This call can return only the form and form resource meta-data (the default), or it can already expand the specified (or all) form resources. See the description of the resources parameter for details.

In the case of resource expansion, for the resources that are of the source type (text, JSON etc.), this method will do its best to transform the resource content into the correct JSON type (for example, a JSON object, or a JSON text node). For binary resources, the content resource property will contain raw bytes.

body.raw:
(GUIDE) <
	gdl_version = <"0.1">
	id = <"das28_test">
	concept = <"gt0001">
	language = (LANGUAGE) <
		original_language = <[ISO_639-1::en]>
	>
	description = (RESOURCE_DESCRIPTION) <
		details = <
			["en"] = (RESOURCE_DESCRIPTION_ITEM) <
				copyright = <"">
				keywords = <"DAS28", "Rheumatoid Arthritis">
				misuse = <"Not for use outside of DAS28 or licensing terms.">
				purpose = <"A GDL tool to assess Rheumatoid Arthritis disease activity.">
				use = <"For use as part of rheumatology assessments.">
			>
		>
		original_author = <
			["date"] = <"10/11/2016">
			["email"] = <"mark@operon.systems">
			["name"] = <"Mark Greenhalgh">
			["organisation"] = <"Operon Ltd, UK">
		>
		other_contributors = <"Mark Greenhalgh", "Nadim Anani">
		other_details = <
			["references"] = <"http://www.das-score.nl/das28/en/introduction-menu.html">
		>
	>
	definition = (GUIDE_DEFINITION) <
		archetype_bindings = <
			["gt0003"] = (ARCHETYPE_BINDING) <
				archetype_id = <"openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.das28.v0">
				domain = <"EHR">
				elements = <
					["gt0004"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
						path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0004]">
					>
					["gt0005"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
						path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0005]">
					>
					["gt0006"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
						path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0006]">
					>
					["gt0007"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
						path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0007]">
					>
				>
			>
			["gt0008"] = (ARCHETYPE_BINDING) <
				archetype_id = <"openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.das28.v0">
				domain = <"CDS">
				elements = <
					["gt0009"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
						path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0008]">
					>
				>
			>
			["gt0010"] = (ARCHETYPE_BINDING) <
				archetype_id = <"openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.glasgow_coma_scale.v1">
				domain = <"CDS">
				elements = <
					["gt0011"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
						path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0026]">
					>
				>
			>
			["gt0012"] = (ARCHETYPE_BINDING) <
				archetype_id = <"openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.glasgow_coma_scale.v1">
				domain = <"CDS">
				elements = <
					["gt0013"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
						path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0026]">
					>
				>
			>
			["gt0014"] = (ARCHETYPE_BINDING) <
				archetype_id = <"openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.glasgow_coma_scale.v1">
				domain = <"CDS">
				elements = <
					["gt0015"] = (ELEMENT_BINDING) <
						path = <"/data[at0001]/events[at0002]/data[at0003]/items[at0026]">
					>
				>
			>
		>
		rules = <
			["gt0002"] = (RULE) <
				when = <"$gt0007!=null", "$gt0006!=null", "$gt0005!=null", "$gt0004!=null">
				then = <"$gt0009.precision=2", "$gt0009.magnitude=($gt0004.magnitude + $gt0005.magnitude)">
				priority = <1>
			>
		>
	>
	ontology = (GUIDE_ONTOLOGY) <
		term_definitions = <
			["en"] = (TERM_DEFINITION) <
				terms = <
					["gt0001"] = (TERM) <
						text = <"DAS28 Test">
						description = <"Calculates DAS28 score from observation data.">
					>
					["gt0002"] = (TERM) <
						text = <"DAS28 Calculation">
					>
					["gt0004"] = (TERM) <
						text = <"Tender joints">
						description = <"Count of tender joints.">
					>
					["gt0005"] = (TERM) <
						text = <"Swollen joints">
						description = <"Count of swollen joints.">
					>
					["gt0006"] = (TERM) <
						text = <"ESR">
						description = <"Erythrocyte sedimentation rate.">
					>
					["gt0007"] = (TERM) <
						text = <"Patient global health">
						description = <"Patient global health visual analogue scale.">
					>
					["gt0009"] = (TERM) <
						text = <"Total score">
						description = <"Total DAS 28 score.">
					>
					["gt0011"] = (TERM) <
						text = <"Total score">
						description = <"The sum of the ordinal scores recorded for each of the three component responses.">
					>
					["gt0013"] = (TERM) <
						text = <"Total score">
						description = <"The sum of the ordinal scores recorded for each of the three component responses.">
					>
					["gt0015"] = (TERM) <
						text = <"Total score">
						description = <"The sum of the ordinal scores recorded for each of the three component responses.">
					>
				>
			>
		>
	>
>

url.raw: {{openEhrApi}}/rest/v1/query?aql=select e/ehr_id/value as ehrId, e/ehr_status/subject/external_ref/id/value as subjectId, e/ehr_status/subject/external_ref/namespace as subjectNamespace from EHR e

query.value: select e/ehr_id/value as ehrId, e/ehr_status/subject/external_ref/id/value as subjectId, e/ehr_status/subject/external_ref/namespace as subjectNamespace from EHR e

request.url: {{openEhrApi}}/rest/v1/query?aql=select c/context/start_time/value as start_time, c/name/value as name, c/uid/value as uid from EHR e [ehr_id/value='{{ehrId}}'] contains COMPOSITION c WHERE c/archetype_details/template_id/value = '{{templateId}}'

request.description:
Logs in the specified user, creating a new session in the process.

* If successful, adds the Session token to the Postman environment, which will be used by subsequent Ehrscape calls

A successful call will create a new OpenEHR session for the specified user. The session ID will be returned both as a JSON response to this call, as well as in the Ehr-Session HTTP response header.

In order to ensure that this newly created session is used on subsequent REST requests, the client needs to make the calls with the HTTP request header Ehr-Session value set to the session ID.

Example of a successful call response:

```{
  "action": "CREATE",
  "sessionId": "096c9d95-c434-4c97-a7ee-59e2c521ec33"
}
The response header, with the Ehr-Session set, will look like this:

{
  "Server": "Jetty(9.1.1.v20140108)",
  "Transfer-Encoding": "chunked",
  "Content-Language": "en-US",
  "Content-Type": "application/json;charset=UTF-8",
  "Access-Control-Allow-Origin": "http://localhost:8082",
  "Access-Control-Expose-Headers": "",
  "Access-Control-Allow-Credentials": "true",
  "Ehr-Session": "096c9d95-c434-4c97-a7ee-59e2c521ec33"
}```
Refreshes the timeout on an open session

Returns an OpenEhr template in its web-appropriate representation (as a JSON object).

A note on languages: the web template will be generated with localized names for all the languages that the underlying template supports, unless it is specified differently via the defaultLanguage and languages query parameters, both of which are optional. The defaultLanguage parameter determines the default name for each web template node (the localizedName property), whereas the languages parameter will generate additional localized names inside the localizedNames map for all the languages listed in this parameter (different languages should be separated by a comma: en,sl,no). See the example below.

Note that the underlying OpenEhr template needs to support these languages, or else a 400 error (bad request) will be returned (TMPL-3061).

                <archetype_id>
                  <value>openEHR-EHR-ACTION.service.v0</value>
                </archetype_id>
                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                  <items id="description">A general clinical activity carried out for the patient to receive a specified service, advice or care from an expert healthcare provider.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                  <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                  <items id="text">Tree</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                  <items id="description">Service request to healthcare provider is planned.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service planned</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                  <items id="description">Appointment for a healthcare provider service has been made.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service scheduled</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                  <items id="description">The healthcare provider has delivered the service.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service delivered</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                  <items id="description">All service activities have been completed.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service activity complete</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                  <items id="description">The referral has been ceased before the service has been completed.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service abandoned</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                  <items id="description">The planned service has been postponed.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service postponed</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                  <items id="description">The planned service has been cancelled prior to commencement.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service cancelled</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                  <items id="description">The service has been suspended without completion.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service suspended</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                  <items id="comment">Coding of the specific service name with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                  <items id="description">Identification of the clinical service to be/being carried out.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service name</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                  <items id="comment">For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the service.</items>
                  <items id="description">Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified service was carried out.</items>
                  <items id="text">Reason</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                  <items id="description">Narrative description about the service, as appropriate for the pathway step.</items>
                  <items id="text">Description</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                  <items id="description">Type of service to be carried out or being carried out.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service type</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                  <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                  <items id="text">Tree</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                  <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.</items>
                  <items id="text">Requestor identifier</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                  <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
                  <items id="text">Requestor</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                  <items id="description">The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.</items>
                  <items id="text">Receiver identifier</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0019">
                  <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for referral.</items>
                  <items id="text">Receiver</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                  <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Service delivered' pathway step. For example: record that this is the 3rd physiotherapy appointment in a planned sequence.</items>
                  <items id="description">The sequence of the specified clinical service.</items>
                  <items id="text">Sequence</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0023">
                  <items id="description">The referral has expired before the referral episode has been completed.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service expired</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                  <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Service scheduled' pathway step.</items>
                  <items id="description">The date and/or time on which the service is intended to be performed.</items>
                  <items id="text">Scheduled date/time</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0026">
                  <items id="description">Request for service sent.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service request sent</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0027">
                  <items id="comment">Use to capture detailed, structured information about specified aspects of the service.</items>
                  <items id="description">Structured information about the service.</items>
                  <items id="text">Service detail</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0028">
                  <items id="description">Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.</items>
                  <items id="text">Comment</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0029">
                  <items id="description">Mulitimedia representation of a performed service.</items>
                  <items id="text">Multimedia</items>
                </term_definitions>

                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                  <items id="description">Relevant contact for the patient or client, including formal and informal carers, next of kin and key workers.</items>
                  <items id="text">Relevant contact</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                  <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                  <items id="text">Tree</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                  <items id="description">The date at which the list of key contacts was created or updated.</items>
                  <items id="text">Date updated</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                  <items id="description">Personal details of the informal carer.</items>
                  <items id="text">Personal details</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                  <items id="description">Any additional comment or note about the carer or their role.</items>
                  <items id="text">Note</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                  <items id="description">True if this informal care is  the person's next-of-kin.</items>
                  <items id="text">Is next of kin?</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0030">
                  <items id="description">For an informal carer, the personal relationship with the client/carer e.g spouse or friend . For a formal carer, the professional role or responsibility of the carer with respect to the person which should help identify them as being an appropriate contact for an aspect of care, usually a professional role or care pathway name.</items>
                  <items id="text">Relationship</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0035">
                  <items id="description">The broad category of care relationship which the contact hods with the subject.</items>
                  <items id="text">Relationship category</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0036">
                  <items id="description">An individual identified by the person as offering care and support, excluding paid carers or carers from voluntary agencies.</items>
                  <items id="text">Informal carer</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0037">
                  <items id="description">The contact is identified by the subject as being a primary informal source of care and support.</items>
                  <items id="text">Main informal carer</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0038">
                  <items id="description">A health and social care professional or staff member, including a carer from voluntary sector.</items>
                  <items id="text">Formal care worker</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0039">
                  <items id="description">The formal carer is the subject's key worker.</items>
                  <items id="text">Key formal care worker</items>
                </term_definitions>

                <archetype_id>
                  <value>openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis.v1</value>
                </archetype_id>
                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                  <items id="comment">Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.</items>
                  <items id="description">Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.</items>
                  <items id="text">Problem/Diagnosis</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                  <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                  <items id="text">structure</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                  <items id="comment">Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                  <items id="description">Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.</items>
                  <items id="text">Problem/Diagnosis name</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                  <items id="comment">Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of clinical recognition" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.</items>
                  <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.</items>
                  <items id="text">Date/time clinically recognised</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                  <items id="comment">If severity is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the Specific details SLOT.</items>
                  <items id="description">An assessment of the overall severity of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                  <items id="text">Severity</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                  <items id="comment">Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                  <items id="description">Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                  <items id="text">Clinical description</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                  <items id="comment">Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. 

</items>
                  <items id="description">Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                  <items id="text">Body site</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0030">
                  <items id="comment">Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of resolution" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.
</items>
                  <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.</items>
                  <items id="text">Date/time of resolution</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0032">
                  <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                  <items id="text">Tree</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0039">
                  <items id="comment">Use this SLOT to insert the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location archetypes if the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations.

If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, use of this SLOT becomes redundant.

</items>
                  <items id="description">A structured anatomical location for the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                  <items id="text">Structured body site</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0043">
                  <items id="comment">May include structured detail about the grading or staging of the diagnosis; diagnostic criteria, classification criteria or formal severity assessments such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.</items>
                  <items id="description">Details that are additionally required to record as unique attributes of this problem or diagnosis.</items>
                  <items id="text">Specific details</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0046">
                  <items id="comment">Use status or context qualifiers with care, as they are variably used in practice and interoperability cannot be assured unless usage is clearly defined with the community of use. For example: active status - active, inactive, resolved, in remission; evolution status - initial, interim/working, final; temporal status - current, past; episodicity status - first, new, ongoing; admission status - admission, discharge; or priority status - primary, secondary.</items>
                  <items id="description">Structured details for location-, domain-, episode- or workflow-specific aspects of the diagnostic process.</items>
                  <items id="text">Status</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0047">
                  <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis does not interfere with normal activity or may cause damage to health if left untreated.</items>
                  <items id="text">Mild</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0048">
                  <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis causes interference with normal activity or will damage health if left untreated.</items>
                  <items id="text">Moderate</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0049">
                  <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis prevents normal activity or will seriously damage health if left untreated.</items>
                  <items id="text">Severe</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0069">
                  <items id="description">Additional narrative about the problem or diagnosis not captured in other fields.</items>
                  <items id="text">Comment</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0070">
                  <items id="description">The date this problem or diagnosis was last updated.</items>
                  <items id="text">Last updated</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0071">
                  <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                  <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                  <items id="text">Extension</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0072">
                  <items id="description">Narrative description about the course of the problem or diagnosis since onset.</items>
                  <items id="text">Course description</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0073">
                  <items id="description">The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.</items>
                  <items id="text">Diagnostic certainty</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0074">
                  <items id="description">The diagnosis has been identified with a low level of certainty.</items>
                  <items id="text">Suspected</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0075">
                  <items id="description">The diagnosis has been identified with a high level of certainty.</items>
                  <items id="text">Probable</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0076">
                  <items id="description">The diagnosis has been confirmed against recognised criteria.</items>
                  <items id="text">Confirmed</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0077">
                  <items id="comment">Data captured/imported as "Age at onset" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.</items>
                  <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.</items>
                  <items id="text">Date/time of onset</items>
                </term_definitions>
              </children>
              <cardinality>
                <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
                <is_unique>false</is_unique>

                  <lower_included>true</lower_included>
                  <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
                  <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
                  <lower>0</lower>
                </interval>
              </cardinality>
            </attributes>

              <items id="text">Ad hoc heading</items>

                <archetype_id>
                  <value>openEHR-EHR-ADMIN_ENTRY.relevant_contact_rcp.v1</value>
                </archetype_id>
                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                  <items id="description">Relevant contact for the patient or client, including formal and informal carers, next of kin and key workers.</items>
                  <items id="text">Relevant contact</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                  <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                  <items id="text">Tree</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                  <items id="description">The date at which the list of key contacts was created or updated.</items>
                  <items id="text">Date updated</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                  <items id="description">Personal details of the informal carer.</items>
                  <items id="text">Personal details</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                  <items id="description">Any additional comment or note about the carer or their role.</items>
                  <items id="text">Note</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                  <items id="description">True if this informal care is  the person's next-of-kin.</items>
                  <items id="text">Is next of kin?</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0030">
                  <items id="description">For an informal carer, the personal relationship with the client/carer e.g spouse or friend . For a formal carer, the professional role or responsibility of the carer with respect to the person which should help identify them as being an appropriate contact for an aspect of care, usually a professional role or care pathway name.</items>
                  <items id="text">Relationship</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0035">
                  <items id="description">The broad category of care relationship which the contact hods with the subject.</items>
                  <items id="text">Relationship category</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0036">
                  <items id="description">An individual identified by the person as offering care and support, excluding paid carers or carers from voluntary agencies.</items>
                  <items id="text">Informal carer</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0037">

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.exclusion_specific.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">A statement of exclusion of a specific Problem/diagnosis, Family history, Medication, Procedure, Adverse reaction or other clinical item that is either not currently present, or have not been present in the past.</items>
              <items id="text">Exclusion - specific</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="comment">This statement is to be used in conjunction with the 'Excluded concept' data element. For example: this data element can support recording general statements such as "No known history of ..." where the 'Excluded concept' identifies the specific problem, diagnosis, substance, procedure or medication. If the 'Excluded concept' data element is used to record a precoordinated term such as 'No family history of diabetes', this element is redundant.</items>
              <items id="description">A qualifying statement about the exclusion of a Problem/diagnosis, Family history, Medication, Procedure, Adverse reaction or other clinical item.</items>
              <items id="text">Exclusion statement</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="comment">Use this data element in one of two ways. Firstly, exclusion of family history of diabetes can be expressed by using 'Family problem/diagnosis' as the run-time name constraint and 'diabetes' as the value for this data point. Alternatively the value could contain precoordinated terms such as 'No past family history of diabetes'.

Coding of the value for 'Excluded concept', either as a simple or precoordinated term, with a terminology is desirable where possible.

If a precoordinated term is used with this data element the 'Exclusion statement' becomes redundant.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the specific concept which has been excluded.</items>
              <items id="text">Excluded concept</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis to which the 'Exclusion statement' applies. For example: 'Diabetes', 'COPD' or 'Asthma'.</items>
              <items id="text">Problem/diagnosis</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">The Family history item to which the 'Exclusion statement' applies. For example: 'Heart desease', 'Diabetes' or 'Alzheimer'.</items>
              <items id="text">Family problem/diagnosis</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="description">The Medication to which the 'Exclusion statement' applies. For example: 'Paracetamol', 'Codeine' or 'Antidepressants'.</items>
              <items id="text">Medication</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0007">
              <items id="description">The Procedure to which the 'Exclusion statement' applies. For example: 'Heart surgery' or 'Appendectomy' or 'Hip replacement'.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0008">
              <items id="description">The Adverse reaction substance/agent to which the 'Exclusion statement' applies. For example: 'Penicillin', 'Peanuts' or 'Latex'.</items>
              <items id="text">Adverse reaction substance</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0011">
              <items id="comment">For example: Local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0012">
              <items id="description">Additional narrative about the Specific Exclusion not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
          </children>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="comment">Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.</items>
              <items id="description">Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.</items>
              <items id="text">Problem/Diagnosis</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">structure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="comment">Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.</items>
              <items id="text">Problem/Diagnosis name</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="comment">Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of clinical recognition" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.</items>
              <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.</items>
              <items id="text">Date/time clinically recognised</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="comment">If severity is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the Specific details SLOT.</items>
              <items id="description">An assessment of the overall severity of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="text">Severity</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="comment">Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="text">Clinical description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0012">
              <items id="comment">Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. 

</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="text">Body site</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0030">
              <items id="comment">Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of resolution" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.
</items>
              <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.</items>
              <items id="text">Date/time of resolution</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0032">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0039">
              <items id="comment">Use this SLOT to insert the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location archetypes if the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations.

If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, use of this SLOT becomes redundant.

</items>
              <items id="description">A structured anatomical location for the problem or diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="text">Structured body site</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0043">
              <items id="comment">May include structured detail about the grading or staging of the diagnosis; diagnostic criteria, classification criteria or formal severity assessments such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.</items>
              <items id="description">Details that are additionally required to record as unique attributes of this problem or diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="text">Specific details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0046">
              <items id="comment">Use status or context qualifiers with care, as they are variably used in practice and interoperability cannot be assured unless usage is clearly defined with the community of use. For example: active status - active, inactive, resolved, in remission; evolution status - initial, interim/working, final; temporal status - current, past; episodicity status - first, new, ongoing; admission status - admission, discharge; or priority status - primary, secondary.</items>
              <items id="description">Structured details for location-, domain-, episode- or workflow-specific aspects of the diagnostic process.</items>
              <items id="text">Status</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0047">
              <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis does not interfere with normal activity or may cause damage to health if left untreated.</items>
              <items id="text">Mild</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0048">
              <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis causes interference with normal activity or will damage health if left untreated.</items>
              <items id="text">Moderate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0049">
              <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis prevents normal activity or will seriously damage health if left untreated.</items>
              <items id="text">Severe</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0069">
              <items id="description">Additional narrative about the problem or diagnosis not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0070">
              <items id="description">The date this problem or diagnosis was last updated.</items>
              <items id="text">Last updated</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0071">
              <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0072">
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the course of the problem or diagnosis since onset.</items>
              <items id="text">Course description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0073">
              <items id="description">The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.</items>
              <items id="text">Diagnostic certainty</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0074">
              <items id="description">The diagnosis has been identified with a low level of certainty.</items>
              <items id="text">Suspected</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0075">
              <items id="description">The diagnosis has been identified with a high level of certainty.</items>
              <items id="text">Probable</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0076">
              <items id="description">The diagnosis has been confirmed against recognised criteria.</items>
              <items id="text">Confirmed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0077">
              <items id="comment">Data captured/imported as "Age at onset" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.</items>
              <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.</items>
              <items id="text">Date/time of onset</items>
            </term_definitions>
          </children>

                    <archetype_id>
                      <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.device.v1</value>
                    </archetype_id>
                    <term_definitions code="at0000">
                      <items id="description">An instrument, apparatus, implant, material or similar, used in the provision of healthcare. In this context, a medical device includes a broad range of devices which act through a variety of physical, mechanical, thermal or similar means but specifically excludes devices which act through medicinal means such as pharmacological, metabolic or immunological methods.  The scope is inclusive of disposable devices as well as durable or persisting devices that require tracking, maintenance activities or regular calibration, recognising that each type of device has specific data recording requirements.</items>
                      <items id="text">Medical Device</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0001">
                      <items id="comment">This data element will capture the term, phrase or category used in clinical practice. For example: <brand name><machine> (XYZ Audiometer); <size> <brand name> <intravenous catheter> (14G Jelco IV catheter); or <brand name/type> <implant>. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible, although this may be local and depending on local supplies available.
</items>
                      <items id="description">Identification of the medical device, preferably by a common name, a formal fully descriptive name or, if required, by class or category of device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Device name</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0002">
                      <items id="description">Narrative description of the medical device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Description</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0003">
                      <items id="comment">Not applicable if a category is already recorded in 'Device name'.
 Example: if the 'Device' is named as a 'urinary catheter'; the 'Type' may be recorded as 'indwelling' or 'condom'.Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible. This may include use of GTIN or EAN numbers.</items>
                      <items id="description">The category or kind of device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Type</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0004">
                      <items id="description">Name of manufacturer.</items>
                      <items id="text">Manufacturer</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0005">
                      <items id="description">Date the device was manufactured.</items>
                      <items id="text">Date of manufacture</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0006">
                      <items id="description">The number assigned by the manufacturer which identifies a group of items manufactured at the same time, usually found on the label or packaging material.</items>
                      <items id="text">Batch/Lot number</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0007">
                      <items id="comment">This date usually applies only to single use or disposable devices.</items>
                      <items id="description">Date after which the device/product is no longer fit for use, usually found on the device itself or printed on the accompanying packaging.</items>
                      <items id="text">Date of expiry</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0008">
                      <items id="description">Additional narrative about the device not captured in other fields.</items>
                      <items id="text">Comment</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0009">
                      <items id="description">Further details about specific properties about the medical device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Properties</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0018">
                      <items id="description">Additional structured informations about identified components of the device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Components</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0019">
                      <items id="comment">For example: Owner, Contact details, Location, Network address, Date due for replacement, Calibration details etc.</items>
                      <items id="description">Further details about management and maintenance of the device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Asset management</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0020">
                      <items id="description">Number assigned by the manufacturer which can be found on the device, and should be specific to each device., its label, or accompanying packaging.</items>
                      <items id="text">Serial number</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0021">
                      <items id="comment">Often fixed to the device as a barcode.</items>
                      <items id="description">A numeric or alphanumeric string that is associated with this device within a given system.</items>
                      <items id="text">Unique device identifier (UDI)</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0022">
                      <items id="description">The exact number assigned by the manufacturer, as it appears in the manufacturer's catalogue, device labeling, or accompanying packaging.</items>
                      <items id="text">Catalogue number</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0023">
                      <items id="description">The exact model number assigned by the manufacturer and found on the device label or accompanying packaging.</items>
                      <items id="text">Model number</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0024">
                      <items id="comment">Coding of the name of the identifier with a coding system is desirable, if available.</items>
                      <items id="description">Unspecified identifier, which can be further specified in a template or at run time.</items>
                      <items id="text">Other identifier</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0025">
                      <items id="comment">When the medical device is an actual software application, record the version of the software using this data element. When the medical device has multiple software applications embedded within it, record each software component in a separate CLUSTER archetype within the Components SLOT - either as a nested instance of another CLUSTER.device archetype or using a CLUSTER archetype designed specifically for recording software details (but not yet available at time of this archetype development).</items>
                      <items id="description">Identification of the version of software being used in the medical device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Software version</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0026">
                      <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                      <items id="text">Extension</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0027">
                      <items id="comment">For example: a technical diagram of a device, or a digital image.</items>
                      <items id="description">Digital representation of the device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Multimedia</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                  </children>
